review_title: Administration ran this place into the ground
job_title: Registered Nurse in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Co-workers are the only glue holding this place together
cons: Administrators create bad policies which drives good workers away. Leadership is tone deaf to the real problems facing the staffing crisis and sweep big issues under the rug. Leadership also gaslights and overexaggerate problems at other facilities to justify mandated unsafe staffing ratios. The phrase, "it's this bad everywhere" is subjectively and undeniably false. Southeast has been the lowest paying hospital in the region for years and they have actually decreased 401K contributions and stopped offering any match. Currently, the nursing staff is comprised of about 50% independent contractor/ travel nurses.

review_title: SoutheastHEALTH is headed in the right direction!
job_title: Director in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: The “family” atmosphere and hometown feel is prominent at Southeast. Generally, people are friendly and welcoming. The CNO is committed to improving Patient Experience. Quality measures are being reviewed more consistently throughout the organization. Leadership is now transparent with many initiatives. The Town Halls that the CEO holds a couple time a year are excellent. The Experience University classes are always fun and entertaining. I’m proud to call Southeast my home!
cons:
Less than competitive salary for frontline staff can make it difficult for managers to recruit talented staff. You can have a great work environment, but if the salary offered isn’t competitive, staff may still seek opportunities elsewhere (or never even apply in the first place).
Physicians are allowed to follow a different code of conduct than the rest of the staff. If the physician wants something, they get it immediately. If other staff members want/need something, it’s a struggle.

review_title: Hotbed of Rumors and Thin Skin
job_title: Pharmacist in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Regular shifts. Most coworkers professional and even friendly. Competitive compensation.  Established in the community.
cons: Though most employees are helpful and professional, a handful of spiteful, hateful people run the show. If you are not one of the "in" crowd, if you are newer (esp. not from the area), you'd best hope you're a runway model with a perfect life. Those fitting those descriptions were the ones protected from unequal treatment. If you are hired here, you'd better hope that no one around you has a bad day. If they do, and they feel like lashing out at you, you will be written up and likely fired if it happens more than a couple of times, even if you are not truly guilty of being anything other than helpful. When I was hired, there was some diplomacy and understanding in middle management. When I left, these traits were completely gone. I would not work here again without an extreme and unlikely shift in the corporate culture.

review_title: Joining this company has been one of the greatest decisions I’ve made in my career to date.
job_title: Talent Acquisition Specialist in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Company culture is truly what you get when you come on board. They care about their people from the top down and really do try to make every employee experience a great one.
cons: Working in healthcare has its challenges and like most companies you’re asked to do a lot BUT unlike most places it’s appreciated and valued for doing so.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: I appreciate that the department heads have confidence in their employees to take on new tasks and responsibilities.  Employees in other departments seem to appreciate what we do for them and along side them.
cons: Compensation reflective of increased responsibilities would be appreciated.  I hired in at the same time as a co-worker, in the same position, and was hired in at a lower pay rate.  We have the same education and comparable experience.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Cape Girardeau, MO

cons: Many benefits have been adjusted to the benefit of the employer, sacrifice of the employee. Raises froze for awhile due to instititions financial difficulties. This has improved. Yearly raise has been reduced from 3% to the new high of 2%. This is sad.

review_title: Make your employees happy and your organization will be great again.
